info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 6 at 9:35PM CDT until April 9 at 11:36PM CDT by NWS Birmingham AL
info.description:
...The National Weather Service in Birmingham AL has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Alabama...
Tallapoosa River At The Tallapoosa Water Plant affecting Montgomery and Elmore Counties.
.Heavy rainfall has occurred since Sunday morning over the Tallapoosa River Basin and a flood warning is now in effect for the Tallapoosa River Basin.
* WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...Tallapoosa River at The Tallapoosa Water Plant.
* WHEN...From Monday evening to late Wednesday evening.
* IMPACTS...At 15.0 feet, Low areas near the junction with the Coosa River begin to overflow. Extensive flooding of low lying areas begins between US 231 and the river at stages of 15 to 25 feet. At 25.0 feet, Extensive flooding of lowland areas begins west of the river and north of Anderson Road between stages of 25 to 30 feet. Any livestock and farm equipment should be moved to higher ground. At 25.5 feet, Dozier Road on the Montgomery County side is closed due to water over the roadway.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:15 PM CDT Sunday the stage was 10.1 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late tomorrow evening to a crest of 28.6 feet Tuesday evening. It will then fall below flood stage late Wednesday morning. - Flood stage is 25.0 feet.
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
&&
The next statement will be issued Monday afternoon, or sooner if conditions warrant.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM MONDAY EVENING TO LATE WEDNESDAY EVENING
